Class Table

java.lang.Object
com.tablr.model.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents a table in the application, contains multiple columns and rows. A table can be created, renamed, modified by adding/removing columns, and it supports operations to manipulate row data.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a new table with the given name.

    • createColumn

      public void createColumn()
      Creates and adds new column to the table with default configuration. Column is named "ColumnN" where N is a unique identifier.

    • isValidColumnValue

      public boolean isValidColumnValue(int columnId, Object value)
      Checks if given value is valid for column with given id
      Parameters:
      columnId - | ID of column
      value - | value to be checked
      Returns:
      True if value is valid, False otherwise.

    • getColumnByIndex

      public Column<?> getColumnByIndex(int index)
      Gets the column at the given index. Used internally to avoid direct access to columns list.
      Parameters:
      index - | index of the column (0-based)
      Returns:
      Column at the given index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • replaceColumnById

      public void replaceColumnById(int columnId, Column<?> newColumn)
      Replaces a column by ID with a new column of a different type.
      Parameters:
      columnId - | ID of the column to replace
      newColumn - | New column to place at same index
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the original column doesn't exist

      Checks if a column with the specified name exists.
      Parameters:
      columnName - The name of the column.
      Returns:
      True if the column exists, otherwise false.
